section.title: Backup
section.p: It is recommended to create a regular backup of the following data according to the general guidelines of the data center:

ul.li:
database (bss). The frequency of database backups depends on the amount of changes and on the availability of time slots with low load. PostgreSQL supports database backups without previous shutdown. For details, refer to the PostgreSQL documentation.
Make sure to also make a backup of the file containing the key required for encryption and decryption of service parameters with data type PWD and custom attributes marked for encryption. By default, this file is named key and located in the following directory:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/glassfish/domains/bes-domain/config
The location of this file can be changed using the KEY_FILE_PATH configuration setting.
Certificates contained in the bes-domain keystore and truststore (keystore.jks and cacerts.jks files).
log files located in the configured directory.
Customizations made to marketplaces, especially style sheets and localized texts presented at the user interface.

p.note: When preparing for an update installation of your current release, always create a backup of all data mentioned above.

section.title: Recovery
section.p: If you need to recover your installation, the recommended procedure is as follows:

li.p: Make sure that all JMS messages have been processed. They are stored in the bssjms database. For example, check the JMS broker as follows:
where 8076 is the port where the JMS broker is running.

ol.li: Stop the domain and the master indexer domain.
Restore the bss database from the backup using the relevant PostgreSQL commands.

Make sure that the file containing the key required for encryption and decryption of service parameters with data type PWD and custom attributes marked for encryption exists in the location specified in the KEY_FILE_PATH configuration setting. By default, this file is named key and located in the following directory:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/glassfish/domains/bes-domain/config
If the file is missing, copy it from your backup to the correct location.

Start the domain.
The search index is rebuilt automatically.
